title: Bug 108822 - More efficient logic is expected to process disk sorting when there is a large number of rows to sort
OB: When sorting on disk and processing 40000 rows of data with a program that is set to process less than 40000 rows, the current logic performs the following steps: 1. Save the file as a temp file 2. Call the file into memory 3. Sort the data 4. Save the sorted file as a temp file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk. 2. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows. 3. Observe the following steps taken by the program:  a. Save the file as a temp file  b. Call the file into memory  c. Sort the data  d. Save the sorted file as a temp file
